Unusual file creation or transfer activi.Data: Zeek smb.log, Zeek ftp.log, Windows Event ID 5140, Windows Event ID 5145, Windows Event ID 4663
Unusual file creation or transfer activi.Action: Monitor Zeek smb.log, ftp.log, and Windows Event IDs (5140, 5145, 4663) for file access/transfer events between internal hosts. Identify file names or hashes transferred. Use correlation analysis to find identical files appearing on multiple hosts within a short timeframe. Calculate baseline file transfer volume and flag significant deviations using descriptive statistics or time series analysis.

Suspicious processes executing file tran.Data: Windows Event ID 4688, Zeek conn.log, Zeek http.log, Zeek ssh.log
Suspicious processes executing file tran.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 for creation of processes associated with file transfer utilities (scp, rsync, curl, etc.) originating from unusual parent processes or command line arguments. Analyze Zeek logs (conn.log, http.log, ssh.log) for connections from internal hosts to known cloud storage service domains or unexpected external IPs on ports used by file transfer protocols. Use frequency analysis to identify rare process executions or connection destinations.
